content: 1 PAUL, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
content_old: 1 PAUL, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

content: 2 In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;
content_old: 2 In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

content: 3 But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
content_old: 3 But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

content: 4 To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
content_old: 4 To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

content: 5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:
content_old: 5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

content: 6 If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.
content_old: 6 If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

content: 7 For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;
content_old: 7 For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

content: 8 But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;
content_old: 8 But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

content: 9 Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.
content_old: 9 Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

content: 10 For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:
content_old: 10 For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

content: 11 Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
content_old: 11 Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.

content: 12 One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.
content_old: 12 One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

content: 13 This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;
content_old: 13 This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

content: 14 Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.
content_old: 14 Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

content: 15 Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.
content_old: 15 Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

content: 1 But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:
content_old: 1 But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

content: 2 That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.
content_old: 2 That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.

content: 3 The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;
content_old: 3 The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

content: 4 That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,
content_old: 4 That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

content: 5 To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.
content_old: 5 To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

content: 6 Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.
content_old: 6 Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

content: 7 In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,
content_old: 7 In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

content: 8 Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.
content_old: 8 Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

content: 9 Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;
content_old: 9 Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;

content: 10 Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.
content_old: 10 Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

content: 11 For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,
content_old: 11 For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

content: 12 Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;
content_old: 12 Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

content: 13 Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;
content_old: 13 Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

content: 14 Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.
content_old: 14 Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

content: 1 Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,
content_old: 1 Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

content: 2 To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.
content_old: 2 To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

content: 3 For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
content_old: 3 For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

content: 4 But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,
content_old: 4 But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

content: 5 Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
content_old: 5 Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

content: 6 Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
content_old: 6 Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

content: 7 That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
content_old: 7 That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

content: 8 This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.
content_old: 8 This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

content: 9 But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
content_old: 9 But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

content: 10 A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;
content_old: 10 A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

content: 11 Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.
content_old: 11 Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

content: 12 When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.
content_old: 12 When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

content: 13 Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.
content_old: 13 Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

content: 14 And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
content_old: 14 And let ours also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.
